I remember being there and I had never seen so many people in my life 

The audience was huge and packed front to back and there were people who were still trying to get in!

And it was my first time I had smelled so much pot like every where lol 

And then I was allowed to see queen from backstage or really more like the side and I don't know from what perspective the energy was more intense 

Be it from the audience or from the stage it's self it was none the less very exciting

But everyone in the audience and even in the hallways of the stadium kept commenting on not only how loud it was but that it was the best sound quality they ever experienced compared to other concerts.

I believe aside from the bands who played there and their own great performances that it was the sound quality that made the concert one of the most  memorable shows ever and surely one of the best experiences to ever have.

I was just a young kid in the UK but I remember it well, everyone was watching it or listening to it all day. Some were taping it on Betamax or VHS on likely now well stretched tapes - some were getting out old Crown tape recorders to record it. No internet then, no mobile phones waving and many people weren't expecting much from Queen, they were kind of old hat, something your dad liked - then .. THIS

What most people forget is that up until that point the music at Live Aid had been pretty average. U2 had livened things up but the music in the afternoon was really from bands who weren’t used to playing packed stadiums and who had built their careers on pop songs and videos and weren’t able to pull off a twenty minute set. Queen and then Bowie and Elton John really got things going. And out of everyone it’s the Queen  who everyone remembers. Truly one of the great performances ever.

I  was at live aid and what makes this so special is that Queen have choreographed a concert into a 20 minute slot. Most other acts from the Who to Paul Mccartney just played a set of four of five songs and went off for the next act. What Queen did was to play the audience with a musical operetta of their hits and with such great showman to do it. It really did lift the crowd and you can see that. Its a masterclass in how to fill 20 minutes of rock music. I doubt any other band would or could do it but that it was makes Freddie so special.

A comment was made that Live Aid was more than "just Queen".  When it came to performance sets as far as music, YES, Queen took the #1 spot. The viewers watched this epic 16 hour show to donate and enjoy the music. Queen took it extremely serious and did exactly what they were supposed to do, and absolutely nailed it. They were brilliant & they rehearsed it; a lot! Most important; they were there for the CAUSE; not to promote. So, yeah, there is quite a bit to hype about over them.  If anyone is interested in the behind scenes on why they excelled, watch the video from Wings of Pegasus (awesome guy) on 'why Queen were so good at Live Aid'.  Fil explains it in detail, and the appreciation for what Queen did simply puts a deep appreciation for it. Other than that, keep enjoying this decades later to all of the bands that performed. ✌💖
